gui.components
Class GUIConveyor

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JLabel
                  gui.components.GuiComponent
                      gui.components.GUIConveyor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants, TReceiver
public class GUIConveyor
extends GuiComponent

GUIConveyor is a graphical representation of the conveyer component that transfers glass around the factory

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

GUIConveyor

public GUIConveyor(DisplayPanel p,
                   ConveyorDirections direction,
                   int speed,
                   int capacity,
                   int index,
                   Transducer t)
constructor to give GUIConveyor its direction and other properties. ImageIcons and direction-velocities are set according to the ConveyorDirections direction parameter.

Parameters:
factoryPanel - the FactoryPanel containing this GUIConveyor
capacity - the max blocks the GUIConveyor can contain
direction - the direction of the conveyor. Used to choose correct image icon and directions.
speed - the speed of the conveyor when moving

Checks to see if GUIConveyor movement is turned on (boolean moving); if so, calls moveParts()

overrideMovingTo

public void overrideMovingTo(boolean b)
ONLY for Conveyor Status&Control Panel! Manual override for the moving state of the conveyor.

Parameters:
b - set moving: true or false

cancelMovingOverride

public void cancelMovingOverride()
Called from the Conveyor Status&Control Panel when the user changes a conveyor's control back to "AUTO". If a moving state change was lost to the override, this method also restores the "lost" moving state

is conveyor movement on

public void eventFired(TChannel channel,
                       TEvent event,
                       java.lang.Object[] args)
Description copied from class: GuiComponent
Called every time the transducer is fired. Corresponds to an Agent command, to which the component should respond.

Specified by:
